title: GCVieweR
text: GCVieweR available GitHub
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("nvelden/GCVieweR")

title: GCVieweR
text: visualize single gene cluster, minimum requirements start stop positions gene, typically named “start” “stop”. addition group can defined used color coding genes used default categorical variable legend.
code: # Example data for a single Gene cluster gene_cluster <- data.frame(   name = c("ophB1", "ophC", "ophA", "ophD", "ophB2", "ophP", "ophE"),   start = c(2522, 5286, 9536, 12616, 13183, 19346, 20170),   stop = c(4276, 4718, 10904, 11859, 15046, 16016, 21484),   class = c("Monooxygenase", "NTF2-like", "Methyltransferase",    "O-acyltransferase", "Monooxygenase", "Prolyloligopeptidase",    "F-box/RNHI-like") ) GC_chart(gene_cluster,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           height = "200px"          )

title: GCVieweR
text: visualizing multiple gene clusters, additional variable needed used define clusters (shown ‘cluster’ column ).
code: # Example data for two Gene clusters gene_clusters <- data.frame(   name = c("ophB1", "ophC", "ophA", "ophD", "ophB2", "ophP", "ophE",             "dbophE", "dbophP", "dbophB4", "dbophD2", "dbophA", "dbophB3", "dbophD1", "dbophC", "dbophB2", "dbophB1"),    start = c(2522, 5286, 9536, 12616, 13183, 19346, 20170,              20583, 21283, 27217, 27371, 28937, 32392, 36331, 37262, 40469, 40768),    stop = c(4276, 4718, 10904, 11859, 15046, 16016, 21484,             19236, 24607, 25288, 28885, 30516, 34679,  34955, 37791, 38089, 43005),    class = c("Monooxygenase", "NTF2-like", "Methyltransferase", "O-acyltransferase", "Monooxygenase", "Prolyloligopeptidase", "F-box/RNHI-like",             "F-box/RNHI-like", "Prolyloligopeptidase", "Monooxygenase", "O-acyltransferase", "Methyltransferase",    "Monooxygenase", "O-acyltransferase", "NTF2-like", "Monooxygenase", "Monooxygenase"),    cluster = c("ophA", "ophA", "ophA", "ophA", "ophA", "ophA", "ophA",                "dbophA","dbophA", "dbophA", "dbophA", "dbophA", "dbophA", "dbophA", "dbophA", "dbophA", "dbophA")  ) GC_chart(gene_clusters,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           cluster = "cluster",           height = "300px"          )

title: GCVieweR
text: gene cluster one can add title, gene labels, cluster label footer shown example . adjust positioning labels, x, y, position variables can used. Note example, GC_labels() employed twice: initially, sets labels uniformly gene clusters, specifically adjusts fourth label (considering index starts 0) cluster 2, ensure overlap. adjust position styling specific labels one can use cluster itemStyle variables. cluster variable one can select specific cluster name number. Using itemStyle variable one can provide list index number specific label styles applied . Note index itemStyle starts 0. detailed examples adjust styling, positioning, settings elements, see Reference documentation function.
code: GC_chart(gene_clusters,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           cluster = "cluster",           height = "420px"          ) %>%   GC_title(     title = c("Gene Cluster"),      subtitle = c("Omphalotus Olearius", "Dendrothele Bisporus")     ) %>%   GC_labels("name") %>%   GC_clusterLabel(title = unique(gene_clusters$cluster)) %>%   GC_footer(     title = c("Nr. of Genes: 7", "Nr. of Genes: 10"),      subtitle = c("Locus: 2522 - 21,484", "Locus 19,236 - 43,005")     ) GC_chart(gene_clusters, start = "start", stop = "stop", group = "class", cluster = "cluster", height = "360px") %>%   GC_title(c("Omphalotus Olearius", "Dendrothele Bisporus"), position = "left", x = 20) %>%   GC_labels("name", y = 25) %>%   GC_labels("name", cluster = 2, y = 25, itemStyle = list(list(index = 3, y = 50))) %>%   GC_footer(title = c("Nr. of Genes: 7", "Nr. of Genes: 10"), subtitle = c("Locus: 2522 - 21,484", "Locus 19,236 - 43,005"), position = "center", y = -30) GC_chart(gene_clusters,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           cluster = "cluster",           height = "360px") %>%   GC_labels("name", y = 30) %>%   GC_labels("name",              cluster = 2,              y = 30,             itemStyle = list(               list(index = 3, y = 50, fill = "red"),               list(index = 7, y = 50, fill = "red")               )             )

title: GCVieweR
text: color legend genes can controlled colorScheme customColors variables.

title: GCVieweR
text: Defines predefined color scheme legend, “schemeCategory10” “schemeAccent” D3.js. maintain consistency color representation apply colorScheme legend gene elements.
code: GC_chart(gene_cluster, start = "start", stop = "stop", group = "class", height = "100px") %>%   GC_legend(legendOptions = list(colorScheme = "schemeAccent")) %>%   GC_genes(colorScheme = "schemeAccent")

title: GCVieweR
text: Defines predefined set colors, customColors allows specifying exact colors group legend.
code: custom_color_map =c("#F8766D","#00BA38","#619CFF","#F564E3","#FFC61E","#00BFC4")  GC_chart(gene_cluster, start = "start", stop = "stop", group = "class", height = "100px") %>%   GC_legend(legendOptions = list(customColors = custom_color_map)) %>%    GC_genes(customColors = custom_color_map)

title: GCVieweR
text: GC_chart() function, parameters scale_breaks, scale_break_threshold, scale_break_padding can used avoid issues widely spaced genes within cluster. Setting scale_breaks TRUE introduces breaks genomic scale avoid long empty stretches. scale_break_threshold defines spacing percentage genes needed activate breaks. scale_break_padding controls padding around breaks.
code: # Without scale breaks GC_chart(gene_cluster,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           height = "100px",           scale_breaks = FALSE)

title: GCVieweR
text: default minimum maximum genes start stop positions used position genes along sequence. Using GC_scale function one can specify values. addition one can add breaks sequence excluded.
code: # Without custom scale GC_chart(gene_clusters,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           cluster = "cluster",          height = "200px") %>%   GC_coordinates() # Without custom scale GC_chart(gene_clusters,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           cluster = "cluster",          height = "200px") %>%   GC_scale(        ) # With scale breaks GC_chart(gene_cluster,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           height = "100px",           scale_breaks = TRUE,          scale_break_threshold = 20,          scale_break_padding = 1)

title: GCVieweR
text: GC_grid() function can used modify grid specific cluster. example height margins adjusted second gene cluster.
code: # With scale breaks GC_chart(gene_clusters,           start = "start",           stop = "stop",           group = "class",           cluster = "cluster",          height = "200px" # Total height                            # since there are 2 clusters in the data                            # the height will be 200px each          ) %>%    GC_grid(     cluster = 2, # Set to NULL to adjust all clusters     height = "80px",     margin = list(left = "5px", right = "5px", top = "0px", bottom = "0px")   )

title: Gene Cluster Visualizations in R
text: GCVieweR provides streamlined tool visualizing gene clusters R, capabilities comparing multiple clusters, customizing color schemes, adding labels, annotations, interactive tooltips enhanced genomic data analysis.

title: Gene Cluster Visualizations in R
text: can install development version GCVieweR GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("nvelden/GCVieweR")

title: Gene Cluster Visualizations in R
text: example demonstrates using GCVieweR plot gene cluster genomic sequence, using start stop positions gene. genes grouped class. Additional functions used include title, labels, legend, scale bar.
code: library(GCVieweR)  # Data gene_cluster <- data.frame(   name = c("ophB1", "ophC", "ophA", "ophD", "ophB2", "ophP", "ophE"),   start = c(2522, 5286, 9536, 12616, 13183, 19346, 20170),   stop = c(4276, 4718, 10904, 11859, 15046, 16016, 21484),   class = c("Monooxygenase", "NTF2-like", "Methyltransferase",    "O-acyltransferase", "Monooxygenase", "Prolyloligopeptidase",    "F-box/RNHI-like") )  # Chart GC_chart(gene_cluster, group = "class", height = "200px") %>%   GC_title("omphalotin gene cluster") %>%   GC_labels("name") %>%   GC_legend(position = "bottom") %>%   GC_scaleBar() %>%    GC_clusterLabel(title = "ophA")

what: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
text: Generates interactive GC chart genomic data.

title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
code: GC_chart(   data,   start = "start",   stop = "stop",   cluster = NULL,   group = NULL,   width = "100%",   height = "400px",   background_color = "#0000",   elementId = NULL,   scale_breaks = FALSE,   scale_break_threshold = 20,   scale_break_padding = 1 )

title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
text: data Data frame containing genomic information. start Column name indicates start positions. Default "start". stop Column name indicates stop positions. Default "stop". cluster Optional column name used clustering purposes. Default NULL. group Column name used gene grouping influence color aesthetics. width Width specification chart, '100%' 500. Default unspecified. height Height specification chart, '400px' 300. Default unspecified. elementId Optional identifier string widget. Default NULL. scale_breaks Logical flag indicating scale breaks employed. Default FALSE. scale_break_threshold Numeric value indicating threshold percentage entire range determining inter-gene regions suitable scale breaks. Default 20. scale_break_padding Numeric value indicating padding percentage entire range either side scale break. Default 1.

title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
text: GC chart widget.

title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart

genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 50, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 80, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 2', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'), group = c('A', 'A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C'), cluster = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2) ) GC_chart(genes_data, group = "group", cluster = "cluster") %>% GC_labels("name") {"x":{"data":{"start":[10,50,90,130,170,210],"stop":[40,80,120,160,200,240],"name":["Gene 1","Gene 2","Gene 3","Gene 4","Gene 5","Gene 6"],"group":["A","A","B","B","A","C"],"cluster":[1,1,1,2,2,2],"rowID":[1,2,3,4,5,6]},"group":"group","backgroundColor":"#0000","legend":{"group":"group","show":true,"position":"bottom","backgroundColor":"#0000"},"series":{"1":{"clusterName":"1","data":{"start":[90,50,10],"stop":[120,80,40],"name":["Gene 3","Gene 2","Gene 1"],"group":["B","A","A"],"cluster":["1","1","1"],"rowID":[3,2,1]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"label":"name","show":true,"itemStyle":[]},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}

what: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
text: function allows set update labels specified clusters within GC chart. provides flexibility terms title, visibility, width, position, additional customization options.

title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
code: GC_clusterLabel(   GC_chart,   title = NULL,   show = TRUE,   width = "100px",   cluster = NULL,   position = "left",   wrapLabel = TRUE,   wrapOptions = list(),   ... )

title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
text: GC_chart GC chart object. title Character vector. title cluster label. Default NULL. show Logical. Whether show cluster label. Default TRUE. width Character. width cluster label. Default "100px". cluster Numeric character vector. Clusters GC chart update. Default NULL. position Character. Position label, either "left" "right". Default "left". wrapLabel Logical. Indicates whether label wrapped. Default TRUE. wrapOptions List. Specifies wrapping options. Default empty List. ... Additional customization arguments cluster label, 'fontSize', 'fontStyle', 'fontWeight', 'fontFamily', 'cursor', etc.

title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
text: Updated GC chart new modified cluster labels.

title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
code:
genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'), group = c('A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C'), cluster = c(1, 1, 2, 2, 2) ) # Set cluster labels GC_chart(genes_data, cluster ="cluster", group = "group") %>% GC_clusterLabel(title = unique(genes_data$cluster)) {"x":{"data":{"start":[10,90,130,170,210],"stop":[40,120,160,200,240],"name":["Gene 1","Gene 3","Gene 4","Gene 5","Gene 6"],"group":["A","B","B","A","C"],"cluster":[1,1,2,2,2],"rowID":[1,2,3,4,5]},"group":"group","backgroundColor":"#0000","legend":{"group":"group","show":true,"position":"bottom","backgroundColor":"#0000"},"series":{"1":{"clusterName":"1","data":{"start":[90,10],"stop":[120,40],"name":["Gene 3","Gene 1"],"group":["B","A"],"cluster":["1","1"],"rowID":[2,1]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"100px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"group":"group","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":{"title":1,"show":true,"wrapLabel":true,"wrapOptions":[],"position":"left"},"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}

what: Modify Coordinates in a GC Chart — GC_coordinates
title: Modify Coordinates in a GC Chart — GC_coordinates
text: function updates GC chart modifying coordinates settings. allows showing hiding tick values, applying custom tick values top bottom axes, supports several customizations specific clusters chart.

title: Modify Coordinates in a GC Chart — GC_coordinates
code: GC_coordinates(   GC_chart,   show = TRUE,   tickValuesTop = NULL,   tickValuesBottom = NULL,   cluster = NULL,   ... )

title: Modify Coordinates in a GC Chart — GC_coordinates
text: GC_chart GC chart object modified. show Logical, whether show tick values . Can single value vector. tickValuesTop Numeric vector NULL, custom tick values used top cluster. NULL, default tick values used. tickValuesBottom Numeric vector NULL, custom tick values used bottom cluster. NULL, default tick values used. cluster Numeric character, specifies clusters affected coordinate modifications. NULL, applies clusters. ... Additional arguments passed coordinate options.

title: Modify Coordinates in a GC Chart — GC_coordinates
text: Returns GC chart object updated coordinates.

title: Modify Coordinates in a GC Chart — GC_coordinates
code:
genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 2', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5'), cluster = c(1, 1, 2, 2, 2) ) # Add coordinates to all clusters GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "name") %>% GC_coordinates() {"x":{"data":{"start":[10,90,130,170,210],"stop":[40,120,160,200,240],"name":["Gene 1","Gene 2","Gene 3","Gene 4","Gene 5"],"cluster":[1,1,2,2,2],"rowID":[1,2,3,4,5]},"group":"name","backgroundColor":"#0000","legend":{"group":"name","show":true,"position":"bottom","backgroundColor":"#0000"},"series":{"1":{"clusterName":"1","data":{"start":[90,10],"stop":[120,40],"name":["Gene 2","Gene 1"],"cluster":["1","1"],"rowID":[2,1]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"name","show":true},"labels":{"group":"name","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":true},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}
Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}},"2":{"clusterName":"2","data":{"start":[210,170,130],"stop":[240,200,160],"name":["Gene 5","Gene 4","Gene 3"],"cluster":["2","2","2"],"rowID":[5,4,3]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"name","show":true},"labels":{"group":"name","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":true},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}
Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}}}},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]} # Modify coordinates of a specific cluster GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "name") %>% GC_coordinates() %>% GC_coordinates( cluster = 2, show = TRUE, tickValuesTop = c(170, 210, 240), tickValuesBottom = c(160, 200), rotate = -45, yPositionTop = 55, yPositionBottom = 45, overlapPercentage = 2, cursor = "default" ) {"x":{"data":{"start":[10,90,130,170,210],"stop":[40,120,160,200,240],"name":["Gene 1","Gene 2","Gene 3","Gene 4","Gene 5"],"cluster":[1,1,2,2,2],"rowID":[1,2,3,4,5]},"group":"name","backgroundColor":"#0000","legend":{"group":"name","show":true,"position":"bottom","backgroundColor":"#0000"},"series":{"1":{"clusterName":"1","data":{"start":[90,10],"stop":[120,40],"name":["Gene 2","Gene 1"],"cluster":["1","1"],"rowID":[2,1]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"name","show":true},"labels":{"group":"name","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":true},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}
Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}},"2":{"clusterName":"2","data":{"start":[210,170,130],"stop":[240,200,160],"name":["Gene 5","Gene 4","Gene 3"],"cluster":["2","2","2"],"rowID":[5,4,3]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"name","show":true},"labels":{"group":"name","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":true,"rotate":-45,"yPositionTop":55,"yPositionBottom":45,"overlapPercentage":2,"cursor":"default","tickValuesTop":[170,210,240],"tickValuesBottom":[160,200]},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}
Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}}}},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

what: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
title: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
text: function allows add footer specific clusters within GC chart. can specify titles, subtitles, control display styling.

title: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
code: GC_footer(   GC_chart,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   height = NULL,   show = TRUE,   cluster = NULL,   subtitleFont = list(),   titleFont = list(),   ... )

title: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
text: GC_chart GC chart object footers added . title Character vector NULL. title displayed footer. Multiple titles can provided different clusters, recycled clusters titles. Default NULL. subtitle Character vector NULL. Subtitles accompany main titles. Default NULL. height Character vector NULL. height footer, can vary clusters. Default NULL. show Logical vector. Controls visibility footer. Default TRUE clusters. cluster Numeric character vector specifying clusters footers added updated. NULL, clusters updated. Default NULL. ... Additional arguments customization footers.

what: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
title: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
text: function configures tooltip gene chart.

title: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
code:
GC_tooltip( GC_chart, formatter = "Start: {start}
Stop: {stop}", show = TRUE, cluster = NULL, ... )

title: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
text: GC_chart gene chart object modified. formatter character string defining HTML content tooltip. can include placeholders like `start` `stop` replaced actual data values. default value shows start stop data. show Logical, whether display tooltip . cluster Optional; used specify clusters chart tooltips. ... Additional arguments can used customize tooltip.

title: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
text: Returns gene chart object tooltip configured.

title: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
code:
# Set tooltip genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'), group = c('A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C') ) # Add tooltips to the gene chart GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group") %>% GC_tooltip(formatter = " Start: {start}
Stop: {stop}") #> Error in GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group"): cluster column not found in data

title: Divide Dimension Value — divide_dimension_value
text: function takes dimension value (can format '100px', '100%', 100) divides given divisor. result returned format input.

code: divide_dimension_value(value, divisor)

title: Divide Dimension Value — divide_dimension_value
text: value character numeric value representing dimension. can format '100px', '100%', 100. divisor numeric value dimension value divided.

title: Divide Dimension Value — divide_dimension_value
text: character numeric value representing divided dimension.

title: Divide Dimension Value — divide_dimension_value
code: divide_dimension_value('100px', 2)  # Returns "50px" #> [1] "50px" divide_dimension_value('100%', 2)  # Returns '50%' #> [1] "50%" divide_dimension_value(100, 2)     # Returns 50 #> [1] 50

what: Identify Non-Coding Regions Between Genes — get_scale_breaks
title: Identify Non-Coding Regions Between Genes — get_scale_breaks
text: Given set gene positions, function calculates returns non-coding regions, potentially added padding. also considers overlapping genes ensures starting position always less ending position gene.

title: Identify Non-Coding Regions Between Genes — get_scale_breaks
code: get_scale_breaks(genes, threshold_percentage = 0, padding = 0)

title: Identify Non-Coding Regions Between Genes — get_scale_breaks
text: genes data.frame containing start end positions genes. data.frame must contain columns named 'start' 'stop'. threshold_percentage Numeric. threshold value given percentage. non-coding regions larger threshold (relative entire genomic region covered) returned. padding Numeric. value given percentage added start subtracted end non-coding region.

title: Identify Non-Coding Regions Between Genes — get_scale_breaks
text: data.frame containing start stop positions identified non-coding regions.

title: Identify Non-Coding Regions Between Genes — get_scale_breaks
code: genes_data <- data.frame(   start = c(10, 50, 90),   stop = c(40, 80, 120) ) get_scale_breaks(genes_data, threshold_percentage = 5, padding = 2) #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$start #> [1] 43.22 #>  #> [[1]]$stop #> [1] 46.78 #>  #>  #> [[2]] #> [[2]]$start #> [1] 83.22 #>  #> [[2]]$stop #> [1] 86.78 #>  #>
